messages.content: After the last general election the Liberal Democrats took a big political risk and decided to put the good of our country ahead of narrow party advantage.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Raising the basic income tax allowance so that thousands of local taxpayers are now £800 a year better off and promoting growth in apprenticeships, 2,480 having been created in this constituency.
Investing in our NHS and good quality education for all. Supporting giving the NHS the £8 billion a year that it needs to keep up with growing demand.
Ensuring that the economy continues to improve and ensuring the steady reduction of the deficit.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet implies a close race between the Liberal Democrats and Conservatives, hinting at tactical voting with the phrase 'Can't win here' referring to Labour and showing past voting percentages.

issues.economy: Committed to fixing the economy and only spending what can be afforded, supporting raising the basic income tax allowance and promoting the growth in apprenticeships.
issues.education: Investing in good quality education for all.
issues.governance: Ensuring the steady reduction of the deficit.
issues.health: Supporting giving the NHS the £8 billion a year that it needs to keep up with growing demand and identifying how to fund this commitment.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes the close race for the constituency and the need for strategic voting. It mentions financial responsibility and education as key areas of focus while critiquing opponent plans for the NHS.
